page.title: 09GOING TO THE YMCA
page.content: .GOING TO THE YMCA by PETER JACKLIN. WHEN I WENT TO THE YMCA IN GRIMSBY.I WENT TO HAVE A LOOK.I ASKED THE PERSON IN CHARGE OF THE BMX TRACK HOW MUCH IT WAS TO TAKE A BMX ON THE TRACK.HE SAID Â£1.50.THE NEXT DAY I BROUGHT MY BMX. AND HE GAVE A TICKET TO BE IN A RACE. I GAVE HIM MY Â£1.50.THAT NIGHT AT 5.30 I WENT TO MY FRIENDS HOUSE IN GRIMSBY. WHEN IT WAS 5.45 I WENT ON MY BIKE TO THE YMCA.WHEN I GOT THERE THE MAN SAID TAKE YOUR BIKE UP THE HILL AND PUT IT IN LINE WITH THE OTHER BIKES.THE RED FLAG WENT DOWN.THEN THE RAMP WENT DOWN WE WENT DOWN THE HILL AND DID THE TABLE TOP AND ONE BOY FELL OFF.THEN ANOTHER BOY WENT OVER HIS HANDLE BARS. THEN WE WENT OVER THE LAST JUMP.THEN IT WAS THE FINISH LINE.I CAME THIRD.THEN I GOT A DRINK.THEN WE WENT HOME AND HAD MY TEA.
